question.text:
Fill in the blanks:

A. India has a greater ....a.... diversity than a Scandinavian country like Norway.

B. The western Ghats have a greater   ....b.... diversity than the eastern Ghats.

C. It has taken millions of years of evolution to accumulate the rich diversity in nature, but we could lose all the wealth in less than ....c....   if the present rates of species losses continue.

D. For many taxonomic groups, species inventories are more complete in ....d.... than in ....e.... countries.

options.text: a-ecological, b-amphibian species, c-two centuries, d-temperate, e-tropical
a-amphibian species, b-ecological, c-three decades, d-temperate, e-tropical
a-ecosystem, b-amphibian species, c-100 years, d-tropical, e-temperate
a-amphibian species, b-ecosystem c-two centuries, d-tropical, e-temperate

solution.text:
India is a tropical country and has higher ecological diversity than temperate regions like Scandinavian nation (Norway). Species inventories are more complete in tropical regions compared to temperate regions.

The western Ghats of India have more variety of amphibian species than in the eastern Ghats.

The current rate of species loss due to current anthropogenic activities the rich diversity of nature accumulated over millions of years will be lost in less than 100 years.
